lines.text: Marcie, you made egg soup!
See? Linus was right. There *is* an Easter Beagle.
Some Easter Beagle! He gave me my own egg!
What do we do with the Easter eggs now that we have them, sir?
We eat them. We put a little salt on them, and we eat them.

[eats her egg, still with the shell on, and gulps it down]
Tastes terrible, sir!

[frying the first batch of eggs]
Uh, sir, how do we color the eggs after we've fried them?
Agh, agh, agh... Aaaugh!
[first lines]
I got the eggs, sir, just like you asked.
Great. Come on in, Marcie.
[Marcie enters]
But *please* quit calling me 'sir'.
It's Easter, and they already have the Christmas decorations up.
Good grief.
I can't believe it.
I told you. It's the *gift* getting season.
You'll see. The Easter Beagle won't let us down.
I know he won't, but how about you?
these eggs are *not* to be fried. Nor are they to be roasted, toasted, or waffled.
Yes, sir.
These eggs have to be boiled. You boil them, then I'll show you how to paint them.
Yes, sir. I'll boil them, sir, then you'll paint them.
Every Easter the Easter Beagle comes dancing along with his basket full of eggs, which he hands out to all the good little children.

That sounds faintly familiar. I remember sitting out in a stupid pumpkin patch all night waiting for The Great Pumpkin to come. And you know something ? He never came! That was the worst night of my life.
But this is different. That was Halloween. This is Easter.
Boy, that kid really can dance. And he sure knows how to make a girl happy. He sure is a funny looking kid, though.
He has a very strange nose, doesn't he, sir?

[seeing Sally and Snoopy laugh as they try on hats]
Okay, you two, let's get on with it. It's shoes you need, not hats.
I know why they have holidays. They have holidays so people can get together and have fun. So why am I alone?
What's the matter with you? All you think about is "gimme, gimme, gimme; get, get, get"!
That's called sur-*vival*, baby!
It's almost Easter, and I have nothing to wear. Look at these shoes! How can I celebrate Easter properly in these shoes?

[to Charlie Brown and Sally]
We're on our way to the store. We got to get ready for Easter. You know, we need Easter baskets, eggs, candy, the works. Want to join us?
I told you it's a waste of time. The Easter Beagle does all that.
Ooh, Linus, you drive me crazy!
Easter Beagle?
Sure, Sally. We don't need to go to all this trouble. On Easter Sunday, the Easter Beagle passes colored eggs to all the good little children.
The Easter Beagle? Are you sure, Linus?
Of course.
Come on, Sally, I thought you wanted to get some new shoes.
This is going to be the greatest Easter Egg Hunt ever, and I'm going to find them all!
